DIVISION OF EDUCATION
MAURICE F. SEAY
DtPECTOR
W. K. KELLOGG FOUNDATION
250 CHAMPION STREET
BATTLE CREEK, MICHIGAN
February 2, 1959
phone wo a*aita
RECEIVED
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
FEB 3 1959
UK! ^ ^
t
Dr* Harry J. Skornia, Exec, Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Uniyersity of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
The planning which you and your friends have been doing with
respect to Teacher Training and Professional Standards Develop¬
ment is indeed fine. I have enjoyed reading your proposal and
although we can not give it serious consideration,, I do hope
that you are able some how to bring it into your program.
As we review our support to this field of interest, we think it
wise to limit our aid at the present time to the project which
we recently approved for the general support of the NAEB. We
are just sorry that we do not ha\e sufficient funds so that we could
be of greater aid to your Association. As I have probably explained
to you, our big problem is that we have presented to us so many
wonderful proposals.
Sincerely and with best wishes,
7n-
Maurice F. Seay
